sn7.10:1.1: Contrast this vivid description of the woes of the rural life with the satisfaction of the wealthy rancher at Snp 1.2.
sn7.10:5.2: For santhāra as “mat” or “carpet” (rather than “blanket”) see SN 35.243:2.1, AN 6.16:2.5, AN 3.35:2.1, AN 3.126:3.7, etc.
sn7.10:6.3: All of whom would have been dependent on their father.
sn7.10:9.1: The Buddha appropriates and transforms the brahmin’s accusations, an early example of reclaiming language to see the “glass half full”.
